text: ICE is releasing illegal immigrants into communities across the U.S. due to a lack of space to house them, while the Adelanto ICE Processing Center in my district currently has only 8 out of 1,932 beds filled due to an outdated COVID-19 court order. This is an unconscionable and deeply troubling waste of taxpayer resources. My letter to @ICEgov here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

As a member of Congress who represents five military installations, I proudly display the seal of each branch in my office. The freedoms we as Americans enjoy are because of our men and women in uniform who dedicate their lives in service to our country.

Secretary of Commerce Gina Raimondo testified before the Science, Space, and Technology Committee recently on the progress made in implementing the semiconductor incentive, manufacturing, and research and development provisions of the CHIPS and Science Act.  It is critical that we conduct robust oversight to ensure these funds are achieving their stated goals. See my questions here:

Mine and Heather’s prayers are with the family of Senator Dianne Feinstein today as we mourn her passing. Senator Feinstein broke many barriers, and her decades of public service have left an enduring impact on our country. I wish her family and all those who loved her peace and comfort in this difficult time.

According to the CBP, there were over 11,000 illegal immigrant encounters in a single day at our southern border this past week. I joined Jennifer Horn and Grant Stinchfield on AM 590 The Answer to discuss the crisis at the southern border and the inept federal policies that are enabling it. Listen here: omny.fm/shows/the-morning-an…

I recently chaired the @housescience Subcommittee on Oversight & Investigation, where I questioned experts on new greenhouse gas emission rules recently enacted by the Administration. These new rules were implemented without congressional authorization and are another example of overreach by the executive branch.

I’m proud to join my colleagues in introducing a resolution to declare this week as #NationalCleanEnergyWeek. America has the highest environmental standards in the world for energy production and produces energy more efficiently and cleaner than any other country. I’m proud to celebrate the innovation of our energy industry as it powers America.

The Preserving Choice in Vehicle Purchases Act is a logical step in fighting for consumer choice & against govt overreach. The bill blocks the EPA from granting a waiver to California for their Advance Clean Cars II regulation which outlaws the sale of gas-powered cars by 2035.
Applications are open to register for the Congressional App Challenge! The deadline to register and submit your app is November 1! More info here: obernolte.house.gov/services…

I met with Col. Bomar of @NTC_UPDATE to discuss the needs of the base & ways to improve life for our military families. I'm proud to have secured provisions in the NDAA to better life on remote & isolated bases. I will continue to fight for our servicemembers, bases & veterans.

Last week a bill I coauthored, the Preserving Choice in Vehicles Purchases Act, passed the House of Representatives! This legislation will prevent the Environmental Protection Agency from issuing a waiver for the State of California that would enable the state to ban the sale of cars powered by internal combustion engines.  This will allow consumers to continue to make their own choices as to which vehicle is best for them and their family.

Last week I had the opportunity to speak with experts about shortages of important drugs, the number one issue local community leaders raised at my health advisory committee. Shortages of chemotherapy drugs, epinephrine kits, and many other drugs can have drastic and even deadly consequences for our local communities.
It is vital that we continue to fund basic science research and adequately staff it’s Office of Inspector General to ensure taxpayers dollars are wisely and appropriately spent.

I had the honor to serve as chairman of @Housescience this past week where I pressed the Secretary of DOE on how we are meeting national challenges such as strengthening U.S. competitiveness in emerging technologies and addressing global issues through innovation.

The Congressional App Challenge is a great opportunity for students in #CA23 to showcase their STEM and technical skills. If you or someone you know would like to participate, please visit: obernolte.house.gov/services…

Fellow California Rep. @KenCalvert  recently joined me on a tour of Victorville-based Exquadrum, a local small business that has supported the High Desert for 20 years. Exquadrum has developed systems and technologies such as leading-edge hypersonic solid-fuel rockets and the testing of rocket engines that will soon land on the moon. Innovations like those produced at Exquadrum are critical to ensuring America remains on the cutting edge of technology.

Truck drivers power our economy, keep store shelves stocked, and deliver supplies when they are needed most. Their dedication and sacrifice deserve to be recognized this #NationalTruckDriverAppreciationWeek.

Today the House is considering the Preserving Choice in Vehicle Purchases Act, which I introduced with @RepJohnJoyce @RepGusBilirakis and Rep. @boblatta to stop the State of California’s proposed ban on gas powered vehicles. People should have the freedom to purchase the vehicle that best serves their needs rather than more burdensome government mandates that further increase their already-high cost of living.

The Congressional App Challenge is back! If you are a middle or high school student interested in STEM, you can sign up for the challenge on my website. The deadline to submit your finished app is November 1.  obernolte.house.gov/services…

Our mobile office hours in Big Bear have been moved from Monday 9/11 to Tuesday 9/12 due to scheduling conflicts with the Big Bear Chamber of Commerce. If you or a family member need help with any federal government agency, please stop by during one of our mobile office sessions to meet with a member of my staff. We are here to serve you!

ICE is releasing illegal immigrants into communities across the U.S. due to a lack of space to house them, while the Adelanto ICE Processing Center in my district currently has only 8 out of 1,932 beds filled due to an outdated COVID-19 court order. This is an unconscionable and deeply troubling waste of taxpayer resources. My letter to @ICEgov here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

It is critical that we conduct robust oversight to ensure these funds are achieving their stated goals. See my questions here:

Listen here: omny.fm/shows/the-morning-an…

People should have the freedom to purchase the vehicle that best serves their needs rather than more burdensome government mandates that further increase their already-high cost of living.

The Congressional App Challenge is back! If you are a middle or high school student interested in STEM, you can sign up for the challenge on my website. The deadline to submit your finished app is November 1.  obernolte.house.gov/services…

Our mobile office hours in Big Bear have been moved from Monday 9/11 to Tuesday 9/12 due to scheduling conflicts with the Big Bear Chamber of Commerce. If you or a family member need help with any federal government agency, please stop by during one of our mobile office sessions to meet with a member of my staff. We are here to serve you!

Today, on the anniversary of the 9/11 terrorist attacks, we pause to remember the tragic loss of life in New York, Washington, D.C. and Pennsylvania. We thank all those who went into battle to defend our nation and our values, and we honor the families who are still grieving unimaginable losses. Today and every day, we will never forget.

I enjoyed meeting with officials from Barstow Community College to learn more about their efforts to expand mental health access for students and improve workforce training development programs. Educational facilities like Barstow Community College serve a critical role in strengthening our workforce and providing better opportunities for our students.

I was honored to address the Victorville Rotary Club to discuss our ongoing legislative work in Congress and my efforts to create a regulatory framework for artificial intelligence. Effective regulation of AI can protect consumers and intellectual property without stifling innovation.

I met with school districts from across #CA23 to discuss pressing issues facing our High Desert schools. I am committed to ensuring that our schools, teachers, and students have access to the resources they need to foster productive and effective learning environments for our children.

The SBA has established a grace period through Saturday, September 16 for homeowners, renters, businesses, and non-profit organizations to apply for physical damage loans in connection with the winter storm disaster. Apply online here: disasterloanassistance.sba.g…
Heather and I would like to wish a happy Labor Day to all of #CA23’s workers! Thank you for all you do to keep our economy strong.

Overdoses are on the rise in #CA23, and awareness can save lives. I will continue to fight to stop the illicit drugs being trafficked into our district and keep these dangerous substances away from our children.

I recently met with my Community Advisory Committee to discuss the many issues affecting life in our community. It is critical that we support our diverse small businesses, address the increasing cost of living, and focus on the substantial learning loss that COVID-19 school shutdowns have caused for our children. I look forward to continuing to partner with this group!

Keeping #CA23 safe is one of my top priorities! I met with public safety officials across our district to discuss ways to reduce violent crime and keep our men and women in uniform safe. Our law enforcement officers and first responders put themselves in harm’s way every day to serve us, and I will continue to fight to ensure they have the resources they need to protect our community.

I joined Jennifer Horn on America First with Sebastain Gorka to discuss Tropical Storm Hilary and the crisis at our southern border that is allowing drugs and human trafficking into our community. Listen to the interview here: sebgorka.com/watch-the-show

Yesterday I joined several of my colleagues in formally requesting that President Biden declare a federal disaster for the State of California to aid in our recovery from Tropical Storm Hillary. Read our letter here:

As we continue to feel the effects of Tropical Storm #Hilary, please make sure you are receiving real-time updates and emergency information. In San Bernardino County you can sign up for real-time updates delivered to your phone at sbcfire.co/alerts

#Hilary is approaching #CA23 with flooding possible throughout our area but particularly near the El Dorado Fire and Apple Fire burn scars. Please be prepared and stay tuned to emergency alerts both during and after the storm to keep you and your family safe.

I met with my Health Care Advisory Committee recently to discuss ways we can improve access to care here in our rural community, including through legislation to reduce doctor shortages, stabilize the Medicare payment system, and increase price transparency. Our district faces unique healthcare challenges, and I am committed to fighting on your behalf for the care we need.

I had the privilege of touring the Local 364’s Apprenticeship Training Facility to see the work they put in to supporting our local tradesmen. Skilled trade workers are in limited supply, and lowering barriers to entry in these fields is critical to both improving opportunities for good-paying jobs and addressing our worker shortage.

#CA23 is home to mining operations that provide critical minerals and materials that America relies on for everything from roads to electric car batteries, and more. I held a meeting of my Mining Advisory Committee recently to discuss how policies in Washington can support local jobs and capitalize on our abundant natural resources to make America stronger.

I toured SA Recycling to see firsthand the work in our community to improve our environmental stewardship. Preventing metal, batteries, and electronic waste from harming our natural landscapes is a critical component of empowering American manufacturing and innovation.

The deadline for post-9/11 veterans to apply to receive backdated benefits under the PACT Act has been EXTENDED TO MONDAY 8/14!  If you or a veteran you know has had their health impacted by exposure to burn pits or other airborne hazards as a result of military service, call the VA hotline at 1-800-MYVA411 or visit this link to learn more and submit your intent to file today! va.gov/resources/the-pact-ac…

August 9 is the final day for post-9/11 veterans to apply to receive backdated benefits under the PACT Act!  If you or a veteran you know has had their health impacted by exposure to burn pits or other airborne hazards as a result of military service, call the VA hotline at 1-800-MYVA411 or visit this link to learn more and submit your intent to file today! va.gov/resources/the-pact-ac…

Since the PACT Act became law, over 600K benefits claims have been filed with @DeptVetAffairs. If you think you are eligible for #ToxicExposure claims, don’t wait – meet with an accredited Veterans Service Organization today or contact my office to help file your claim. va.gov/PACT

Heather and my prayers are with the families and colleagues of the CalFire firefighters and CWN pilot who perished in the line of duty Sunday while protecting our Inland Empire communities. These firefighters are heroes, and we owe an incalculable debt of gratitude to those who put their lives on the line to keep us safe.

It was an honor to speak at the High Desert Chamber of Commerce last week regarding the federal spending crisis, rising energy prices, and possible solutions being passed by the House of Representatives.

I joined Inside California Politics this weekend to discuss my legislation to block California’s proposed ban on gasoline vehicles. Free markets work best when they are fueled by consumer choices, not by government mandates. Watch the clip here: fox40.com/inside-california-…

I am continuing to fight to restore a productive workplace culture at Loma Linda VA and to ensure a better work environment at VA facilities across our country. The best possible care for our veterans can only come from a healthy VA system. sbsun.com/2023/08/02/lawmake…

The Fitch rating agency has now officially downgraded the US credit rating citing “the expected fiscal deterioration over the next three years” and "a high and growing general government debt burden”. The consequences of our federal government’s fiscal irresponsibility are real, and we will experience them both now and in the years to come unless we act. We must institute changes like my Finding Federal Savings Committee to put our nation on the path towards fiscal sanity and a balanced budget. cnbc.com/2023/08/01/stock-ma…

ICYMI, my amendment was adopted into the House-passed FAA reauthorization bill to capitalize on recent innovations by allowing FAA approved high-octane unleaded aviation gasoline to be sold at airports in lieu of 100 octane low-lead aviation gas. This will increase the sustainability of aviation while also improving our environment. Watch the debate here:

Legislation to stop California’s gas-powered vehicle ban advanced through @HouseCommerce last week, teeing up a vote on the House floor. If California bans all gas-powered vehicles, as the California Air Resources Board is attempting to do, our cost of living will increase, blackouts and brownouts will become more frequent, and commuting families in my district will suffer. obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

The House of Representatives passed government funding for military construction and the Department of Veterans Affairs this week, delivering on our promise to reign in government spending while providing our military and our veterans with the resources they need. More in my floor speech here:

The deadline to apply for FEMA and SBA assistance connected to the February and March winter storms has been extended to Sept. 1! If you have questions about these resources or need help in applying, please reach out to my office at 760-247-1815: sbsun.com/2023/07/25/federal…

I am proud to have helped in shaping the FAA Reauthorization bill to ensure a stable and innovative future for America’s aviation industry. Learn more about my provisions in the bill here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

I've worked alongside @RepBost to craft the Restore VA Accountability Act, which addresses the critical deficiencies in VA policies highlighted by the VA Loma Linda whistleblowers. Read more about our bill from @SoCalNewsGroup's @TheChalkOutline here:redlandsdailyfacts.com/2023/…

California has recently experienced several of the worst wildfire seasons in our state's entire history. Technology can help to leverage our firefighting assets to more quickly detect fires and help to protect our communities. More from our recent @HouseScience hearing here:
Cybersecurity education can reduce the frequency of successful cyberattacks by as much as 80%. Read more on my bill to launch an American Cybersecurity Literacy campaign here:

California's annual crime report was intentionally buried in a Friday news dump before the 4th of July because it shows an extremely troubling increase in crime across our state. We must do more to enforce the rule of law and keep our communities safe. calmatters.org/commentary/20…

Impact aid supports many of our local schools near #CA23 bases & federal lands. The FY24 NDAA authorizes $50 million for public schools with military dependent students to help ensure our kids have the resources they need for a bright future. obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

The House-passed NDAA supports our military servicemembers & families with a 5.2% pay increase – the largest in more than 20 years. It also includes provisions I added to support the bases in our district. Read more in my press release here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

ICYMI – the recently-passed House National Defense Authorization Act contains several provisions I authored and championed to support the unique needs of our district and the bases that inhabit it. Watch my speech on the house floor to learn more:

The most commonly used password in America is "password" & in close second is "12345." My bill to launch an American Cybersecurity Literacy Campaign passed out of @HouseCommerce this week and is badly needed to help Americans keep themselves secure online. obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

This year’s National Defense Authorization Act provides critical direction for our nation’s military & strengthens our armed forces now & into the future. I'm proud to have secured the inclusion of multiple provisions to improve life for our military families & servicemembers and to support our base-adjacent communities. obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

My amendment to ensure the King of the Hammers event can continue to take place in the Johnson Valley Shared Use Area was adopted into the NDAA with unanimous support yesterday! King of the Hammers is a major economic driver for the Morongo Basin, and I am proud to ensure it can continue for the benefit of locals, visitors, and marines alike.

The House is debating the FY24 National Defense Authorization Act today, including multiple provisions I have proposed to benefit bases and communities here in the High Desert. Watch my floor speech here:

The @DeptVetAffairs must provide a productive work environment for its employees if we hope to successfully deliver on our promise to America’s veterans. I have been proud to work alongside @HouseVetAffairs Chairman @RepBost to craft the Restore VA Accountability Act, which addresses the critical deficiencies in VA policies highlighted by the whistleblowers from @valomalinda that have come forward to my office.  Read more about our bill here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

I was proud to promote @RepYoungKim's NIST Wildland Fire Communications and Information Dissemination Act in @housescience. This bill will improve communication & info sharing between first responders, fire management response officials & community leaders during wildfires.

It was a pleasure to meet with the #BigBear20 during their Honor! It is always special to see faces from home, but even more special to be granted the privilege of honoring these veterans for their service to our country. To all our veterans, welcome home.

As we fight to combat the flow of fentanyl into our communities, it is critical that we have the difficult conversation with our children to ensure they understand the risks of drugs bought on the street. More in my recent interview with Spectrum News: ny1.com/nyc/all-boroughs/new…

It doesn’t matter how affordable broadband internet is if you don’t have access to it at all. We must address the difficulty of permitting broadband infrastructure across federal land, which is why I introduced my GRANTED Act.  See more here:

If CA bans gas-powered vehicles, as CARB intends to, blackouts & brownouts will become more frequent, our cost of living will increase & constituents in #CA23 will suffer. Watch as I argue in support of my bill to prevent the EPA waiver California needs to execute this policy:

It's my honor to welcome this year's class of summer interns to the U.S. Capitol! My office accepts internship applications on a rolling basis for summer, spring, and fall sessions. Visit my website for information on how to apply: obernolte.house.gov/services…
Happy Independence Day to everyone in #CA23 and across our nation! Today and every day is a great day to be an American. 🦅

I've introduced a bill to prevent the EPA from issuing California a waiver that would allow banning the sale of gasoline-powered vehicles. That bill was heard recently in a House Energy & Commerce subcommittee hearing. Watch my Q&A here:

Fort Irwin recently broke ground on their new project to increase the base's energy resiliency. Projects like these are critical to improving on-base life for soldiers and civilians alike, and to supporting the readiness and mission of our military.

Congratulations to all of this year's graduates! Earning a diploma at any level is a lifelong accomplishment to be proud of. I look forward to seeing what the next generation of #CA23 leaders will accomplish!
The landscape of #CA23 is full of natural wonders and open spaces to explore. As National Camping Month comes to a close and summer begins in earnest, take time this weekend to get outside!

7/10 veterans and 6/10 adults will experience post traumatic stress during their lifetimes. Seeking help can often be intimidating, but it can save your life and those of others. If you or someone you know is suffering with PTS, please reach out for help today.

As Congress crafts the FY2024 National Defense Authorization Act, I’m proud to have secured the inclusion of my provision to increase support services on remote and isolated bases like those located in our district. Watch my recent floor speech here:

I was proud to support the Veteran Entrepreneurship Training Act on the House floor last week to create a Boots to Business program that helps transitioning service members start and grow a business. As our servicemembers transition back to civilian lives, this program is critical to ensuring they have the option to become business owners.

At yesterday's AI hearing in @housescience, I asked our witnesses critical questions about how we can reduce the anthropomorphization of artificial intelligence and put guardrails around emerging technology that will protect our ability to innovate. Watch here:

Yucaipa resident Nicole was in Washington, D.C. this week to accept her Congressional Gold Medal award for completing 400 hours of voluntary public service, 200 hours of personal development, 200 hours of physical fitness, and a five-day, four-night expedition. I was honored to congratulate her personally on her achievement!

As Congress begins to tackle the issue of artificial intelligence, it is vital that we strike a careful balance between protecting consumers and protecting innovation. See my latest op-ed in the @RiponSociety Forum here: riponsociety.org/article/the…

Virtual health is a critical to combating drug addiction in rural communities like #CA23 where treatment facilities & medical care can be far from home. Thank you to our witnesses at @HouseCommerce's recent Health Subcommittee hearing for their testimony on this critical issue.
Happy Father’s Day to all of the great fathers in #CA23!

I conducted an oversight visit at @valomalinda today alongside @HouseVetAffairs staff to discuss systemic workplace culture issues raised by numerous whistleblowers in recent weeks. My investigation is still ongoing, but this was an important step in the process of ensuring our veterans receive the care they deserve.

I have worked with Rep. Anna Luna to address my constitutional concerns with the original resolution to censor Rep. Adam Schiff. I am happy to report that her revised resolution is in keeping with both our duty to enforce accountability in Congress and our pledge to defend the Constitution. She is reintroducing it today, and I look forward to supporting it in the House of Representatives next week.

In response to this winter’s devastating storms, I’ve partnered with @RepMikeGarcia in introducing legislation to improve forecasting of atmospheric rivers and help to mitigate future loss of life and property. Read more about our bill here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

Happy 248th birthday @USArmy! The U.S. Army was established before the birth of our great nation, and our men and women in uniform have helped keep us safe and free since then. Today and every day we honor these heroes for their service to our country.

(photo from @NTC_UPDATE)

Fentanyl-related deaths by over 600% in San Bernardino County in recent years. We must continue to fight to stop the flow of fentanyl onto our streets and to protect our children. Watch my testimony here:

Last week @housescience held a hearing on the state of quantum computing in the U.S. It’s time to begin commercializing this revolutionary technology to accelerate the growth of both American industry and our quantum workforce. Watch my segment of the hearing here:

My office has received several calls from residents who have received “balance due notices” from the IRS in recent days stating that they face a deadline of 21 days to pay their tax balances, despite the disaster declaration extending the tax deadline for most Californians until Oct. 16.  The IRS has now clarified that the 21-day deadline DOES NOT APPLY to those who fall under the disaster declaration. Read the full statement from the IRS here:

I had a productive meeting with my Small Business Advisory Committee recently to discuss issues affecting our local small businesses. Inflation and intrusive overregulation are making it harder and harder for small businesses to stay in business in California. I’m fighting to solve these problems and put our economy back on track so that #CA23 can thrive.

Last week’s Community Coffee in Barstow was transformed into a virtual town hall due to last minute votes requiring my presence in Washington, D.C., but we discussed many important topics including the importance of reducing federal spending and moving our nation towards a balanced budget. Thank you to everyone for your questions! fb.watch/l0p_eFnvz8/

Our Phelan Community Coffee was interrupted while I voted on the Fiscal Responsibility Act, but we were able reconvene afterwards to discuss important issues that affect Phelan and California’s 23rd district. Thank you to everyone in attendance for your patience and your valuable questions!

I met with my Veterans Advisory Council last week to discuss how the VA can better deliver on our nation’s promise to those who have worn our nation’s uniform. We will never stop fighting for our veterans to receive the benefits they deserve.

The Congressional @westerncaucus fights for our western priorities and America’s rural communities in Congress, working to support local control, bolster economic growth, and better manage our public lands. We are now 100 members strong and officially the second-largest caucus on Capitol Hill! westerncaucus.house.gov/news…

The Fiscal Responsibility Act enacts the largest reduction in nondefense discretionary spending in the history of our country, and it accomplishes this without raising taxes, which is why I supported it with my vote in the House this evening. However, this bill still falls short of the significant adjustments to overall federal spending needed to restore fiscal responsibility to our government and put us on a path towards a balanced budget. Passage of this legislation must be just the first small step of many towards accomplishing these goals. I look forward to continuing to work alongside my colleagues in Congress on solutions to achieve this, including proposals such as my Finding Federal Savings Committee.

Read my full statement here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

I joined our mountain communities yesterday for an event in Big Bear memorializing those who gave the last full measure of devotion to our country. Thank you to all who attended to commemorate our fallen service members, and especially to our gold star families here in #CA23. Your sacrifice is not forgotten.

It was an honor to plant flags and spend time with some of our High Desert veterans in Apple Valley today as we commemorate Memorial Day. Today my prayers are with all those who gave their lives in service to our country and with the families, brothers in arms, and loved ones they left behind.

May is Military Appreciation Month! I have been proud to provide certificates of recognition to volunteers, JROTC members & others who have gone above and beyond in answering the call & supporting our #CA23 military servicemembers. I am proud to join this incredible community in standing behind each soldier, marine, airman, sailor and guardian who signed up to defend our country.

I joined my colleagues in demanding an immediate retraction & correction of false statements made by @DeptVetAffairs in a recent press release claiming that the Limit, Save, Grow Act would cut veterans programs. This is patently false. Read the letter here:

California’s new ban all gasoline-powered outdoor power equipment would do immeasurable harm to people in our district. I questioned EPA recently on the status of CA’s waiver request to enforce this restriction. We must be good stewards of the earth, but we can accomplish that through innovation rather than burdensome mandates.

Thank you, Speaker @newtgingrich, for inviting me on to discuss the impacts of AI! This technology will reshape the world we live in. We must work to realize the potential benefits of AI while also enacting safeguards & offsetting the resulting disruptions to our society.

Recent advances in AI have resulted in a surge of congressional interest in this technology. I'm honored to play a role in both educating my fellow members & in working with leadership & colleagues to steer Congress towards workable policy solutions. washingtonpost.com/technolog…

My GRANTED Act will help to increase access to broadband internet in our rural communities, particularly where surrounding federal land ownership has complicated broadband deployment. Read more about the bill here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

The risks, or what we know of them, are far more abstract, but still equally concerning. Balanced against those risks are the potential benefits of AI, which could lead to an explosion in creativity and productivity unlike anything human society has ever experienced.

The postulated dangers of AI have long been embodied in our science fiction movies, our sensationalized news and our own worst imaginations. The reality is that AI is something completely different. thehill.com/opinion/congress…

Over the past several months, I’ve often been asked by reporters, fellow members of Congress and neighbors alike what a future with AI might look like and what role Congress should play in regulating this revolutionary technology. As the only Member of Congress with a graduate degree in AI, and as a computer programmer for over 30-years, here are my thoughts: thehill.com/opinion/congress…

May 15 is National Peace Officer Memorial Day, where we honor law enforcement officers who lost their lives in the line of duty. Thank you to these outstanding individuals and all those who put their lives on the line to keep our community safe.
I’m proud to announce the winners of this year’s Congressional Art Competition! Thank you to all those who participated and congratulations to our winners!

I was proud to support the passage of H.R. 2 today.  This bill will secure our southern border, fight against foreign drug cartels, and keep fentanyl, drug, and human trafficking out of our community.

I was proud to recognize our High Desert youth recently for their accomplishments in JROTC units across our district. These young people are committed citizens devoted to developing their skills and serving our country. Congratulations and thank you for your dedication and public service!

I was proud to recognize 232 individuals and organizations with certificates in acknowledgement of their total 27,625.5 volunteer hours at @NTC_UPDATE! These volunteers are critical to improving live for our servicemembers and their families stationed at Fort Irwin NTC, and it was a pleasure to thank them for their service!

When the United States produces more of its energy domestically, global emissions go down, thanks to the innovation and groundbreaking technology which exists at every level of our energy sector. An ‘all-of-the-above’ energy strategy will ensure American innovation continues to lead the way while protecting the stability of our grid and lowering the energy prices facing everyday Americans.

Last week 15 young adults graduated from Apple Valley Police Activities League S.H.O.C.K. program – a 10-week youth intervention program for teenagers designed to combat the negative influences in society confronting today’s youth. The program emphasizes core values of self-discipline, honor, obedience, character, and knowledge. I was proud to provide certificates of congratulation to these program graduates!

On a recent visit to San Bernardino International Airport, I met with the crew working on a 10 Tanker aircraft that supports wildfire firefighting efforts across our region. Swift and effective air support is critical to controlling wildfires and delivering retardant to key areas to keep our homes and businesses safe.

I enjoyed meeting with representatives from the San Manuel Band of Mission Indians in my Washington, D.C. office last week!  It's an honor to work alongside our local tribes to protect tribal sovereignty and ensure the continuation of their unique cultures.

I joined Brendan Anti’s @StraightTalkPod to discuss the push to regulate Artificial Intelligence and what rapid new developments in technology could mean for human society. Listen here:open.spotify.com/episode/7mJ…

I’m happy to share that through our combined efforts to gain federal disaster support for our mountain communities, FEMA has opened a Disaster Recovery Center in Twin Peaks, where residents affected by the February/March severe storms can get help applying for FEMA assistance and information on available resources. Visit the center at the Peaks Recreation Complex or learn more here: lp.constantcontactpages.com/…
I was honored to preside over the U.S. House of Representatives as Speaker Pro-Tem this week!

I joined @HouseCommerce today for a hearing on data privacy legislation that will be a critical first step towards protecting Americans' digital data. This legislation will ensure Americans’ online autonomy & safeguard some of the potential concerns surrounding data use in AI.

The CBO has confirmed the Limit, Save, Grow Act will reduce the deficit by $4.8T & as a consequence lower interest on the public debt by $500B. We must bring our debt under control & balance the budget. The bill passed by the House today is a strong step in that direction.

I joined @JenniferHorn & @stinchfield1776 on @am590theanswer to talk about the upcoming debt ceiling vote w/ claw-backs & sufficient cuts to bring spending back to pre-pandemic levels. I'm pleased the House is taking the first steps towards bringing our federal budget back in balance: omny.fm/shows/the-morning-an…

The winning artwork from each year’s #CA23 Congressional Art Competition is displayed among winning pieces from across the country in the tunnel where members of Congress, staff, and tourists walk to and from the U.S. Capitol Building every day. This exhibit is an amazing display of the vibrant culture of our United States and the talent of America’s young people. Enter this year’s competition here: obernolte.house.gov/services…

Today is Earth Day! American innovation in energy production has the power to reshape our world and provide greener, cheaper, and more reliable energy around the globe. It is critical that we unleash the power of American energy to protect both our planet and our future.

Yesterday I chaired a hearing of the full @housescience Committee to hear testimony and Q&A about how we can better protect the use of taxpayer dollars. I look forward to continuing to work to address the serious issues at hand and ensure good stewardship of taxpayer funds.

On Friday, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission announced it has elected to pursue a regulatory path for fusion energy that will allow this industry to continue on its promising growth trajectory. This is promising news for all Americans who want cheaper and cleaner energy, and follows a letter I sent alongside the Congressional Fusion Energy Caucus in February this year. Read our letter below and learn more about the decision here: nrc.gov/cdn/doc-collection-n…

The Congressional Art Competition is open to all #CA23 High School students through May 1! Submit your artwork to my office for an opportunity to have your work displayed as part of a U.S. Capitol building exhibit. Learn more about the competition here: obernolte.house.gov/services…

The work environment at VA Loma Linda has hindered the department’s ability to provide the quality services America’s veterans deserve. I’m working alongside @HouseVetAffairs Chairman @RepBost to hold the VA accountable for failing to terminate an employee with a long record of creating a hostile work environment for subordinates at @valomalinda and to ensure this type of systematic failure can never take place again.

ICYMI: My 9-8-8 Lifeline Cybersecurity Responsibility Act passed the House Energy and Commerce Committee to help ensure that this vital resources is never again disrupted due to cyberattack. Learn more about my bill here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

AI has been at the forefront of national conversation thanks to recent developments like ChatGPT. I joined POLITICO Tech recently to discuss how AI and policy might intersect and the AI risks we should actually be paying attention to. Listen here: politico.com/news/2023/03/10…

In addition to supporting H.R. 1 in the House of Representatives, I recently joined my colleagues in calling on Governor Newsom to address misguided state policies that have limited natural gas in our state. Read our full letter and learn more here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…
Happy Easter to all those celebrating in California’s 23rd District today!

I had a productive meeting with the Victorville Valley Wastewater Reclamation Authority recently to discuss water resources in our region. As we have witnessed this winter, California's problem isn't a lack of water, it's lack of water storage. We must do more to capture water on wet years & ensure adequate supply when dry periods occur.

I spoke at the Redlands Legislative Forum recently among a bipartisan group including @RepPeteAguilar, @supervisorrowe, and @rosilicie. I was encouraged by our frank exchange of ideas, and I look forward to continuing our work on behalf of the community!

I toured the mudslide area in Oak Glen recently to discuss the impact of continued mudslide and flooding in our district and actions we can take to help keep our community safe. We must do more to prevent catastrophic wildfires before they cause this damage.

I am continuing the fight to secure resources to our storm affected communities. My team was on hand at recent @SBCounty storm resource events, but for those unable to attend, more information about resources is available here: lp.constantcontactpages.com/…

When the HALT Fentanyl Act passed out of the @HouseCommerce Committee recently, I sat down with Spectrum News to talk about the importance of this and other legislation to address the fentanyl crisis. Watch the interview here: ny1.com/nyc/all-boroughs/new…

California was one of only four states that failed to repay it’s federal unemployment loans after the COVID-19 pandemic, and it owes the largest amount by far, despite its $97.5B budget surplus last year. Now, our local businesses must repay the state's loan. More in the @sbsun here: sbsun.com/2023/03/27/califor…

Congress must act to protect American’s digital privacy, while also making sure that our nation can defend against malicious uses of artificial intelligence like what is occurring in China. Watch my @FoxBusiness @TheBigMoneyShow clip here: video.foxbusiness.com/v/6323…
Today is National Doctor’s Day! Thank you to all of our doctors working to provide important care across America, particularly those serving rural communities like #CA23.

Families in #CA23 are paying up to 3x last year's natural gas prices as a result of restrictive government energy policies. I'm proud to support H.R. 1 to unleash domestic energy production, fix permitting & lower prices to provide relief for our families.

AI’s benefits to our society will almost certainly far outweigh its drawbacks, but it is critically important that we protect Americans from the misuse of AI systems while still enabling the industry to grow and innovate.
I joined @BretBaier on the Special Report tonight to discuss recent developments in artificial intelligence. foxnews.com/media/congressma…

I've introduced my AI for National Security Act with @RepJimmyPanetta to ensure DOD can use AI systems to detect & combat cyberattacks on their networks. It is critical that we ensure the DOD has the tools to keep pace with attacks from our adversaries. obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

I’m hosting a virtual town hall this evening at 5:00 p.m. to give updates on natural gas prices, the fentanyl crisis and more. Sign up here to receive a call to participate or watch live on my Facebook page: obernolte.house.gov/live

I was granted extra time by my colleagues in @HouseCommerce yesterday to continue pressing TikTok CEO Shou Chew on whether Americans’ data can really be firewalled from Chine (what TikTok calls “Project Texas”).  My assessment is that it’s just not technically feasible.

Today I joined my House colleagues in passing the Parents Bill of Rights to put parents back in control of what their children learn in the classroom. Parents should have the right to a voice in their kid's education.

As a software engineer, I am skeptical it is technically possible for TikTok to do what they've proposed to separate their platform from foreign intervention and keep Americans safe. My opening Q&A in @housecommerce here:

I was proud to provide certificates at a recent community Rotary Club meeting to recognize students who are academically striving to be the best they can be. Congratulations to these outstanding young people on their achievements!

I met with the Trona school district at my Hesperia office last week to talk about the district's urgent needs. Our rural school districts face a unique set of challenges, and I’m working to ensure our children and families have the educational resources they need to thrive.

After many hours advocating with the IRS on your behalf, a new update was issued granting tax relief to all counties impacted by the March winter storms including an extension until Oct. 16, the option to claim disaster-related casualty losses & more. lp.constantcontactpages.com/…

I spoke with members of our realtor community this week about the state of our housing market and the economy. We MUST work to balance the federal budget and get our national debt under control if we hope to put our economy back on track.

I joined San Bernardino County @SheriffDicus in an information exchange with community leaders this week in Hesperia to discuss the fentanyl crisis, public safety, and the ongoing storm response. These conversations are critical to ensuring the safety of our community.

Victorville Mayor Jones rolled out her plans for the future in her State of the City recently. I met with her just days before to discuss ways we can work together to ensure our community is on the right track. Thank you for your leadership, Madam Mayor!

The HALT Fentanyl Act, which I cosponsor, passed @HouseCommerce Health Subcommittee with my strong support. This bill will permanently reschedule fentanyl as a Schedule I controlled substance, giving law enforcement more tools to crack down on fentanyl & keep our kids safe.
I provided Mr. Clutters’ U.S. Government class with pocket constitutions they requested to help further their knowledge about our federal government. I’m glad to see them at use in our classrooms!

I’m excited to announce that my bill to prevent cyberattack disruption of the 9-8-8 National Suicide Hotline passed @HouseCommerce subcommittee last week! This bill will help resolve cybersecurity vulnerabilities & mitigate the risks of future disruptions to this vital service.

I had a productive call with @FEMA_Deanne earlier today to discuss approval & delivery of federal disaster aid to our mountain communities. I appreciate @POTUS' expeditious approval of Gov. Newsom's request! whitehouse.gov/briefing-room…

.@CAgovernor Newsom has officially requested @POTUS make a federal disaster declaration for our mountain areas. I asked the President last week to stand ready for such a request. I will be in contact with his administration today to further those efforts. ocregister.com/2023/03/09/go…

This is not the path of fiscal prudence. Instead, we must immediately reduce federal spending to get inflation under control and take steps towards balancing our federal budget and reigning in our national debt.
The President’s budget proposal would increase federal spending by $400 billion from last year while also raising taxes. The deficit would increase from nearly $1.4 trillion to $1.57 trillion.
This morning the President released his 2024 budget. 🧵

Today is International Women’s Day! I recently had the opportunity to honor one of our hardworking women in law enforcement at my Community Coffee in Yucca Valley. Thank you to all the women who are making a difference in our community today.

Thank you to everyone who is helping to support their neighbors during this snow emergency by delivering food or helping to shovel out snow berms for our senior citizens. It’s in times like these when our small town values mean the most.

.@SheriffDicus & I toured the areas worst affected by the snow emergency to get a better vantage point on how much work is left to go. We also assessed the substantial infrastructure damage these storms have caused. Progress is being made, but there is still a long way to go.

At the recent press conference on the snow emergency in our mountain communities, I reported on our efforts to secure state and federal resources to meet the urgent needs of this crisis.  See more here:

I spent time at incident command to speak to our first responders about resources needed to dig out our mountain communities & make our homes & families safe. The state of emergency is helping, and I’ve asked President Biden to also stand ready for a federal disaster declaration.

Our mountain communities are standing together to recover from this snow emergency. Thank you to our first responders, @SBCFireChief, @SheriffDicus, and county supervisors for your work. We will continue fighting to deliver the resources our residents need.

I’ve asked @POTUS to declare a federal disaster for CA’s mountain communities should @CAgovernor request it. We need all available resources to help our communities recover & avert further catastrophe. Thanks to my colleagues for joining me in this effort.

Thank you to @CAgovernor Newsom for promptly following through on our request to declare a State of Emergency for our mountain areas! It is critical that we rapidly deliver the resources our community needs to swiftly respond and protect public health and safety.

I am leading a letter from many of my California Congressional colleagues to formally request that Governor Newsom declare a State of Emergency in response to the massive snowstorms that have impacted California’s mountain communities. Our full letter to the Governor here:

I will do everything in my power to get CalTrans, the CHP, and the County of San Bernardino the resources they need to resolve this problem. Our top priority must be the safety & safe return home of everyone living in our mountain communities.

Our mountain residents have been severely impacted by the complete closure of many mountain highways in the aftermath of last week’s blizzard.  I met with officials from @Cal_OES as well as had phone calls with both CalTrans and the FEMA Region Administrator.

February 28 is Rare Disease Day! 300 million people are affected by rare diseases & as the world leader in healthcare R&D it is critical that the United States continues to invest in and lead the way towards finding new cures and expanding access to treatments for rare diseases.

With more snow forecast, it is important to keep up to date on new information. The National Weather Service has the latest weather information for the San Bernardino County Mountain Communities here: weather.gov/sgx/

San Bernardino County has opened an emergency hotline for those impacted by the winter storm, along with a shelter & resource center for those stranded down the mountain.
 
Hotline: (909) 387-3911
Animal services: (800) 472-5609
Shelter location: Redlands East Valley High School

This is an important step in making sure we can deliver the resources our community needs. If you need assistance, please contact my office. I am working alongside our local officials to maximize our response & return our community to normal as quickly as possible.

A local state of emergency has been declared for our San Bernardino mountain communities where many residents have been either trapped at home or unable to reach it due to large volumes of snow (with even more snow forecast over the next several days).

It was an honor to meet with @CityofBBL Mayor Randy Putz recently. Our mountain communities face a unique set of issues including land constraints for development and wildfire risks. I look forward to continuing to work with our mountain leadership to address these problems.

This week’s town hall in Yucaipa featured great attendance from our younger generation. Thanks to all for their insightful questions and to our local high schoolers for coming to expand their civic engagement.
Thanks to all who attended my Morongo Basin Community Coffee in Yucca Valley this afternoon! We had a full house despite the weather.

🚨 🚨 Phelan Community Coffee Canceled 🚨 🚨
 
Today’s Community Coffee in Phelan has unfortunately been canceled due to insane road conditions. Please stay tuned for updates on when I will be hosting future events in the area. Stay safe!
My Community Chat in Loma Linda this morning was well attended with great questions from many of our attendees. I’m looking forward to another community coffee event in Yucaipa this evening!

I toured Prime Healthcare recently to discuss SB County’s critical healthcare needs. As a new member of the @HouseCommerce Health Subcommittee, I look forward to working on legislation to help ensure our healthcare system is meeting the unique challenges of our rural community.

I sat down with Victorville Mayor Jones and Mayor Pro-Tem Becerra to discuss Victorville’s plans for the future and new developments and needs for the coming year. Thank you to our local officials for a very productive meeting.

Local programs are critical to providing emergency assistance for homeless youth and victims of human trafficking and domestic abuse. I toured the Family Assistance Program to discuss the resources that facilities like this one need to better support those in crisis situations.
Happy President’s Day! Today we mark the birthday of our nation’s first president, George Washington, and celebrate America’s great presidential leaders who have made our nation strong.

I visited @providence St. Mary Medical Center to talk about how we can expand trauma services & bring new providers to our area. Access to quality, affordable care is our community’s #1 healthcare issue, & I’m committed to ensuring you & your family can get the care you need.

I held a community coffee in California City on Wednesday to speak with residents of Kern County in our new 23rd Congressional District. I look forward to continuing our many productive conversations.
I enjoyed meeting with Adelanto Mayor Gabriel Reyes and City Manager Jessie Flores. I look forward to continuing our partnership to support and improve our community.
Yesterday’s community coffee for our mountain communities took place in Big Bear. It was great to see lots of familiar faces and get to know others. Thank you to all who joined us for the event!
We had a great community coffee kickoff today in Spring Valley Lake! Thank you to all of our high desert residents in attendance.

I reintroducing a bill last week to help prevent devices such as smart thermostats & home security cameras from being compromised by foreign actors. Read more about the bill here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…
My first community coffee of the week will be held in the High Desert tomorrow. If you are interested in attending one of these events, please sign up here: obernolte.house.gov/communit…

This week I reintroduced my Protect American Trade Secrets Act to help U.S. companies defend themselves from intellectual property theft committed by foreign actors, including the Chinese Communist Party. Read more about my bill here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

I'm hosting community coffees across our district over the next several weeks to talk directly with constituents about the issues they care about. Visit my website here to learn more and find an event near you: obernolte.house.gov/communit…

February is Cancer Prevention Month!  Early detection of cancer results in dramatically better outcomes.  Be sure to schedule your annual screenings this month and spread the word to help win the fight against cancer.

I am honored to have been appointed to serve as chairman on the @housescience Investigations & Oversight Subcommittee. Thank you Chairman @RepFrankLucas for your trust as we work to hold government accountable.

In a recent @HouseCommerce Telecom subcommittee hearing, I discussed how new satellite technology can be used to more effectively detect and fight wildfires in California and across the American West. Watch the Q&A here:
My thoughts on tonight’s #SOTU 👇
In @HouseCommerce last week, I talked about the promising future of fusion energy. Watch my Q&A with former DOE Under Secretary for Science Paul Dabbar here:
ICYMI – California’s default on its federal loans is costing our employers. Catch my interview with Frank Mottek on KABC here: omny.fm/shows/kabc-podcasts/…

I'll be live on @KABCRadio's #MottekonMoney at 6:35 p.m. pacific time tonight to talk about my effort to stop California's state government from putting its federal debts on our state's employers. Tune in for more!

Twelve extensions of the COVID-19 public health emergency over three years is far too many. I supported the Pandemic Is Over Act to end executive branch overreach and return power to the American people.
Notably, better fraud enforcement by the Employment Development Department (EDD) alone could make up the difference, given that a recent report found $32 billion paid out by the EDD was fraudulent.

While federal unemployment insurance loans were essential to helping Californians weather the pandemic, it is imperative that the state now repay its loans, as failing to do so risks the financial stability of millions of California employers.

During the COVID-19 Pandemic, the State of California mandated its businesses to be closed substantially longer than other states across the country. Asking those same businesses to now repay the state's federal debt in a year where it had a historic surplus is simply baffling.

California business owners have been notified that they will have to pay additional taxes this year - and indefinitely - until our state has repaid its outstanding $18.5 billion federal unemployment insurance loan debt. The state had a historic $97.5 BILLION surplus in 2022.

I'm leading my colleagues in telling @GavinNewsom that forcing California employers to pay higher FUTA taxes because of the failure of our State to pay its debts, in a year when the State had a multibillion-dollar budget surplus, is nothing short of theft.

My DOE Cost Share Accountability Act passed the House with broad bipartisan support. It’s critical we support research & development projects that could pave the way to a better future, but it’s also our responsibility to ensure agencies act as good stewards of taxpayer dollars.

I reintroduced my Salvage Act last week to help lower fire risks by improving reforestation and salvage operations on federal lands. My bill will provide greater flexibility and expedite forest management to help keep communities like ours safe. More here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

ICYMI - I was proud to support the Strategic Production Response Act on Friday to constrain the reckless release of resources from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve. This bill will ensure a concrete plan is in place to refill the SPR & unleash American energy production.

I reintroduced my SALVAGE Act today because our community is counting on the government to implement comprehensive, science-based forest management strategies on our federal lands to mitigate catastrophic wildfires and protect our homes and our businesses. obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

I am proud to support HR 21 to lower energy prices by requiring the fed. govt to permit at least enough new energy development to replace the petroleum being released from our Strategic Petroleum Reserve. We can fight poverty by unleashing American energy! piped.video/mNRo3U6AhEs

Today we mark #HolocaustRememberanceDay and the anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz-Birkenau Nazi Concentration and Extermination Camp in 1945. We must never forget the horrific events of the Holocaust, nor the hate and fear that drove them.

The 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline experienced an outage in December due to a cyberattack on its system operator. I introduced the 9-8-8 Lifeline Cybersecurity Responsibility Act today alongside @RepCardenas to help prevent this from ever happening again. obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

It’s National #SchoolChoice week, and I’m continuing the fight to ensure that parents and families have the freedom to decide what educational options are best for their children. One-size-fits-all government education does not work.

The Anti-Appropriations Committee’s purpose was to find & reduce underperforming & nonessential federal programs to bring spending back under control. It’s time to reinstitute this committee. Read about my Finding Federal Savings Committee Resolution here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

In 1941, America created an Anti-Appropriations Committee to rein in astronomical New Deal spending. Today, we again face a national debt crisis & according to @USTreasury, reached the federal debt ceiling again last week.

The US essentially maxed out its credit cards again yesterday, hitting the debt ceiling of $31,400,000,000,000 in debt. This level of overspending is irresponsible, and the reason why I've introduced the Obernolte Balanced Budget Constitutional Amendment. foxbusiness.com/politics/gop…
We must act now to remove wasteful government spending, get our federal deficit under control, and stabilize our economy.
My Finding Federal Savings Committee is based on the post-New Deal era Anti-Appropriations Committee and would be dedicated to finding and reducing underperforming and non-essential federal programs.

When I became a Member of Congress, I noted that if we didn't immediately work to put our fiscal house in order, the result would be skyrocketing inflation, higher interest rates, and slower economic growth. We are now experiencing all three.

I'm proud to reintroduce my Finding Federal Savings Committee Resolution with 19 cosponsors to establish a committee in the House with the sole purpose of reducing wasteful federal spending and putting our fiscal house in order 🧵 obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…
I am proud to reintroduce my Balanced Budget Constitutional Amendment that would help get federal spending under control and curb the national debt. Learn more here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…
Throughout our history, leaders like Martin Luther King Jr. have shared a vision for a better and more free America. Today we recognize his legacy and rededicate ourselves to that dream.
My and Heather’s thoughts are with our friends in Riverside County today as the community mourns the death of Sheriff’s Deputy Darnell Calhoun in the line of duty.
I reintroduced my bipartisan bill to ensure transparency and boost accountability at the Department of Energy. Learn more about the Cost-Share Accountability Act here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

Energy security IS national security. Yesterday I voted to keep our Strategic Petroleum Reserves from being sold to our foreign adversaries, and I will continues the fight to unleash American energy independence this Congress.

We must unleash the power of American energy production to stabilize energy prices for American families, keep our nation secure from foreign adversaries, and capitalize on our best-in-class clean energy technologies. obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

Today is #WearBlueDay! Human trafficking in and through #CA23 has significantly increased as the situation at the southern border has worsened. Learn more about how to fight trafficking by recognizing the signs from the DHS Blue Campaign. dhs.gov/blue-campaign

I am honored to have been selected to serve on @HouseCommerce and to have the opportunity to shape policy on some of the most important issues facing America. Read my full announcement here: obernolte.house.gov/media/pr…

America needs a regulatory framework that reflects vast differences between fusion & fission energy and allows these technologies to be implemented & managed appropriately. We also need energy policies that bolster this revolutionary emerging technology: foxnews.com/opinion/video-ga…

Experts predict that fusion energy could lower the average American families energy bill by $820/yr when brought to scale & implemented appropriately. The onus now falls on Congress to ensure that can occur. More in my @FoxNews piece: foxnews.com/opinion/video-ga…

The big breakthrough in fusion energy last month brought us one step closer to dramatically lowering energy costs & revolutionizing green energy, but continued success will depend on whether Congress acts. Read about the how & why in my @FoxNews op-ed: foxnews.com/opinion/video-ga…

Today Pres. Biden will witness the crisis at our border for the first time. It is my sincere hope he is as horrified as I was at the humanitarian & operational crisis & that he listens to our border patrol agents and gives them the resources & support they need.

Although we can and should debate the merits of our immigration policies, we should all be able to agree that those policies won’t matter unless & until we agree to enforce those policies and secure our border.

4.5+ million migrants have crossed our southern border illegally since the start of this presidency (roughly equivalent to the population of Kentucky). Tragically, Mexican drug cartels have achieved operational control of the border, & drugs are flowing freely into our community.

ICYMI – This week President Biden announced his new immigration plan and a long called-for trip to the southern border. The plan includes an expansion of humanitarian programs, but unfortunately no additional physical border security to keep our community safe.
I was (finally) sworn in today as the representative for California’s 23rd Congressional District! It is an honor to continue to serve California’s High Desert and Inland Empire.

If you haven’t already, please take a moment to subscribe to my weekly newsletter using this link. It's a great way to stay civically engaged and informed as we head into the new year! obernolte.house.gov/contact/…
Take my survey today to let me know your thoughts on what issues I should focus on this Congress. Your views are very important to me. obernolte.house.gov/issuessu…
Happy New Year to everyone in the High Desert and Inland Empire!
